roleset.name: move from one place to another
roleset.note: TRANSPLANT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'transplant' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from transplant.01-v predicate notes)
TRANSPLANT-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to transplant.01. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from transplant.01-n)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: But [no one]-1 has made a serious effort *trace*-1 to transplant the crop.

example.name: with destination
example.text: Twenty years later, [two California academics, Stanley Cohen and Herbert Boyer]-1, made ``recombinant'' DNA, *trace*-1 transplanting a toad's gene into bacteria, which then reproduced toad genes.
example.arg: into bacteria, which then reproduced toad genes

example.name: with source
example.text: [Mary's sense of fair play]-1 was transplanted *trace*-1 from Adolf Hitler.

example.name: with arg 1
example.text: Here we offer a review of bone marrow transplants and other types of stem cell transplants that are used to treat cancer.

example.name: 'his' is arg 2 here because he is the receipient/end point. If there is a more specific location included (ie femur), then 'his' would be GOL
Arg1
example.text: A pancreas transplantation is an organ transplant that involves implanting a healthy pancres into a person who usually has diabetes.
